title: 与丹尼尔·哈丁相约莫扎特之夜
short_description: 《c小调弥撒》是莫扎特创作的最优美的宗教作品之一，曲中古朴的合唱与优雅的独唱相互交织，相映成趣。这部作品之所以有如神来之笔，也许是因为其中的一个女高音声部是莫扎特为爱妻康斯坦泽所作。除这部作品外，指挥家丹尼尔•哈丁还将通过短小精悍却又生机勃勃的《第32首交响曲》和两首精妙传神的《音乐会咏叹调》向听众展现莫扎特作品中人性的光芒。

interview.title: 丹尼尔·哈丁对话诺阿·本尼迪-巴格莱
interview.description: In April 2018, the Berliner Philharmoniker played an all-Mozart programme under the direction of Daniel Harding. In addition to the incomplete yet consummate Mass in C Minor, they performed his little-known Symphony No. 32 plus two concert arias which expressed both the humorous and the melancholy side of the composer. To mark the performance with the Philharmoniker, the conductor talked to Noah Bendix-Balgley, one of the orchestra’s First Concertmasters. Harding, who gained his early experience as an assistant to Sir Simon Rattle and Claudio Abbado and regularly performs with the Philharmoniker, discusses among other things the spiritual dimension of polyphony and explains why Mozart’s works demand of their performers a specific balance of security and self-doubt.
interview.short_description: 2018年4月，丹尼尔·哈丁在一场音乐会中指挥柏林爱乐乐团上演了多部莫扎特的作品。在这里，他与柏林爱乐的第一乐队首席诺阿·本尼迪-巴格莱聊起了他对维也纳古典作品的理解。
